Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a Facebook post and a meme, without any credible sources or evidence provided.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that NASA has not added a new star sign to the zodiac, as confirmed by NASA themselves in their Twitter post and blog post.
Understate: There is no evidence of any understatement bias in the claim.
Exaggerate: There is no evidence of any exaggeration bias in the claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of any faltering bias in the claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that NASA has added a new star sign to the zodiac without providing any reliable evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation provided by NASA is that the Babylonians left out the 13th constellation, Ophiuchus, for the sake of a "tidy match" with their 12-month calendar.
